data.enText: to make sth less tight or firmly fixed; to become less tight or firmly fixed

data.chText: 先松开螺母，然后卸下车轮。
data.enText: First loosen the nuts, then take off the wheel.
The rope holding the boat loosened.
to make a piece of clothing, hair, etc. loose, when it has been tied or fastened
to hold sb/sth less tightly
He loosened his grip and let her go.

data.chText: 军事政权尚未放松对权力的控制。
data.enText: The military regime has not loosened its hold on power.
to make sth weaker or less controlled than before

data.chText: 这个政党与大企业的关系疏远了。
data.enText: The party has loosened its links with big business.
loosen sb's tongue

data.chText: 使无拘束地说话；使自由自在地说
data.enText: to make sb talk more freely than usual

data.chText: 一瓶酒下肚，哈里的话匣子便打开了。
data.enText: A bottle of wine had loosened Harry's tongue.
loosen up
to relax and stop worrying

data.chText: 得啦，乔，放松些，别再担忧了。
data.enText: Come on, Jo. Loosen up.
loosen up
loosen sb/sth↔up
to relax your muscles or parts of the body or to make them relax, before taking exercise, etc.

ex.chText: 一杯热咖啡能够帮助你放松下来。
ex.enText: A cup of hot coffee can help to relax you.

ex.chText: 委员会认为应放宽移民管制。
ex.enText: The committee believed that immigration controls should be relaxed.

synonyms.bx: 尤指工作之余放松休息；也指放松身体部位或放宽规定、法令。

ex.chText: 听了这些话，她松开了抓着他胳膊的手。
ex.enText: Hearing these words, she loosened her grip on his arm.

ex.chText: 是什么使国会同意放宽出口限制？
ex.enText: What made the Congress agree to loosen the restrictions on exports?

ex.chText: 根据最近的一项调查显示，逾50%的受访者认为政府对媒体的控制已大大放松了。
ex.enText: According to a recent survey, over 50% of respondents believe the government has loosened its hold on the media considerably.

synonyms.bx: 指松开某物；也指放宽法律、规定或控制。

ex.chText: 起风的时候你可以稍微放松绳子。
ex.enText: You can slacken the ropes slightly when there is wind.

ex.chText: 听到她同意留下，他抓着她的手放松了。
ex.enText: Hearing that she agreed to stay, his grip on her slackened.

data.enText: loosen sb's tongue

data.chText: 使无拘束地说话；使自由自在地说
data.enText: to make sb talk more freely than usual

data.chText: 一瓶酒下肚，哈里的话匣子便打开了。
data.enText: A bottle of wine had loosened Harry's tongue.
loosen up
to relax and stop worrying

data.chText: 得啦，乔，放松些，别再担忧了。
data.enText: Come on, Jo. Loosen up.
loosen up
loosen sb/sth↔up
to relax your muscles or parts of the body or to make them relax, before taking exercise, etc.

tr: become loose or looser or less tight

example: loosen the tension on a rope

tr: disentangle and raise the fibers of

example: The rules relaxed after the new director arrived
The government relaxed the curfew after most of the rebels were caught

value.def: If someone loosens restrictions or laws, for example, they make them less strict or severe.

example.ex: Many business groups have been pressing the Federal Reserve to loosen interest rates...
example.tran: 不少企业集团一直在向联邦储备委员会施压，要求其放松利率管制。

example.ex: Drilling regulations, too, have been loosened to speed the development of the fields.
example.tran: 钻探条例亦已放宽，以加速油田的开发。

example.ex: Domestic conditions did not justify a loosening of monetary policy.
example.tran: 国内的情况并不足以成为放松货币政策的正当理由。

value.def: If someone or something loosens the ties between people or groups of people, or if the ties loosen, they become weaker.

example.ex: The Federal Republic must loosen its ties with the United States...
example.tran: 联邦共和国必须疏远其与美国的关系。

example.ex: The deputy leader is cautious about loosening the links with the unions...
example.tran: 该政党的二把手对疏远与工会之间关系一事态度谨慎。

example.ex: The ties  that bind them together are loosening.
example.tran: 将他们紧密联系在一起的纽带正在弱化。

value.def: If you loosen your clothing or something that is tied or fastened or if it loosens, you undo it slightly so that it is less tight or less firmly held in place.

example.ex: He reached up to loosen the scarf around his neck...
example.tran: 他伸手松了松脖子上的围巾。

example.ex: Loosen the bolt so the bars can be turned...
example.tran: 松一松插销，好转动门闩。

example.ex: Her hair had loosened and was tangled around her shoulders.
example.tran: 她的头发打了开来，散乱地披在肩上。

value.def: If you loosen something that is stretched across something else, you make it less stretched or tight.

example.ex: Insert a small knife into the top of the chicken breast to loosen the skin.
example.tran: 在鸡胸上方插进一把小刀，以使鸡皮不要绷得太紧。

value.def: If you loosen your grip on something, or if your grip loosens, you hold it less tightly.

example.ex: Harry loosened his grip momentarily and Anna wriggled free...
example.tran: 哈里的手稍一放松，安娜便挣脱出来。

example.ex: When his grip loosened she eased herself away.
example.tran: 他紧抓她的手松了一下，她便抽身而出。

value.def: If a government or organization loosens its grip on a group of people or an activity, or if its grip loosens, it begins to have less control over it.

example.ex: There is no sign that the Party will loosen its tight grip on the country...
example.tran: 没有迹象显示该党会放松对国家的严密控制。

example.ex: The Soviet Union's grip on Eastern Europe loosened.
example.tran: 苏联对东欧的控制已经放松。

value.def: If you say that something has loosened someone's tongue, you mean that it has made them talk about something, often when they should have remained silent.

example.ex: The wine had loosened his tongue.
example.tran: 酒一下肚，他便打开了话匣。

trans: 放松；（情况）缓和；（使）（肌肉）松弛；（使）做准备活动
